gurmukhi: bHm khXo qumhUM hmhUM iml jwih qhwN ijh hY bRqDwrI ]jwie krY ibnqI iqh kI rGunwQ suno ieh bwq hmwrI ]9]
transliteration: Brahm Kahyo Toumhoon Mil Jaah(i) Tahaan Jih Hai Brat-dhdaree|| Jaae Darai Bintitih Kiraghounaath Souno Eh Baat Hamdaree||9||
translation: Brahma said, “We two will go to the supreme Vishnu in order to request him to listen to our supplication.”9.

gurmukhi: bHm ko A`gR sBY DrkY su qhwN ko clY qn ky qnIAw ]qb jwie pukwr krI iqh swmuih rovq qw muin jXo hnIAw ]
transliteration: Brahm Ko Aggra Sabhai Dharkai Su Tahaan Ko Chalai Ttan Ke Taneeaa||
translation: All the powerful people went there under the leadership of Brahma; the sages and others began to weep before the supreme Vishnu as if someone had beaten them;

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI Aiq hI aupmw kb ny mn Biqr XO gnIAw ]ijm lUty qy AgRj cauDrI kY kutvwr pY kUkq hY bnIAw ]10]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Kiat(i) Hioupmaa Kab Ne Man Bheetar Yaudgadeeaa|| Jim Loote Te Agraj Chaudharikai Koutvaar Pai Kookat Hai Baneeaa||10||
translation: The poet mentioning the beauty of that spectacle says that those people appeared like a trader crying before a police officer having been plundered at the instance of the headman.10.

gurmukhi: lY bHmwsur sYn sBY qh daur gey jh swgr BwrI ]jwie pRnwm kro iqnko ApnY liK bwrin bwr pKwrI ]
transliteration: Lai Brahmaasur Sain Sabhai Tah Daur Gad Jah Saagad Bhdaree|| Jaae Pranaam Daro Tinko Apnai Lakh(i) Baaran(i) Baar Pakhdaree||
translation: Brahma reached the milk-ocean alongwith the gods and the forces and washed the feet of the supreme Vishnu with water;

gurmukhi: pwie pey cqurwnn qwih ky dyiK ibvwn qhw bRiqDwrI ]bHm khXo bHmw kh jwhu Aauqwr lY mY jr dYqn mwrI ]11]
transliteration: Paae Pae Chaturaanan Taah(i) Ke Dekh(i) Bivaan Tahaa Brat(i)dhdaree|| Brahm Kahyo Brahmaa Kah Jaah(u) Aoutaar Lai Mai Jar Daitan Mdaree||11||
translation: Seeing that supreme Immanent Lord, the four-headed Brahma fell at his feet whereupon the Lord said, “You may leave, I shall incarnate and destroy the demons.”11.

gurmukhi: sRaunn mY suin bHm kI bwq sBY mn dyvn ky hrKwny ]kYkY pRnwm cly giH Awpn lok sBY Apny kr mwny ]
transliteration: Sraounan Mai Soun(i) Brahm Kibaat Sabhai Man Devan Ke Harkhaane|| Kaikai Pranaam Chale Grah Aapan Lok Sabhai Apne Kar Maane||
translation: Listening to the words of the Lord, all the gods were pleased and went back to their places after paying their obeisance to him;

gurmukhi: qw Cibko js au`c mhwN kb ny Apny mn mY pihcwny ]goDn BwNq gXo sB lok mno sur jwie bhor kY Awny ]12]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i)ko Jas Ouchch Mahaan Kab Ne Apne Man Mai Paihchaane|| Godhan Bhaant Gado Sabh Lok Mano Sur Jaae Bador Kai Aane||12||
translation: Visualising that spectacle the poet said that they were going back like a herd of cows.12.

gurmukhi: iPir hir ieh AwigAw deI dyvn skl bulwie ]jwie rUp qumhUM Dro hau hUM irhO Awie ]13]
transliteration: Phir(i) Har(i) Eh Aagiaa Daidevan Sakl Bulaae|| Jaae Roop Toum-hoon Ddaro Hau Hoon Dharihau Aae||13||
translation: Then the Lord called all the gods and ordered them to incarnate before him.13.

gurmukhi: bwq sunI jb dyvqn kot pRnwm ju kIn ]Awp smyq suDwmIAY lIny rUp nvIn ]14]
transliteration: Baat Sounijab Devtan Kot Pranaam Ju Keen|| Oop Samet Sudhaameeai Leene Roop Naveen||14||
translation: When the gods heard this, they bowed and assumed the new forms of cowherds alongwith their wives.14.
